signature.embedding_text: A sells an article to B at X percent profit, B sells it to C at Y percent profit, if C pays Z rupees what did A pay for the article, find original cost price from final selling price in successive profit chain

trick.name: Fraction Reversal
trick.one_liner: Profit % ko fraction mein badlo, ulta karke multiply karo

steps.action: Profit % ko fraction mein convert karo
steps.example: 20% profit = SP is 120% of CP = 6/5 of CP

steps.action: Wapas jaane ke liye fraction ulta karo
Final price se saare ulte fractions multiply karo

trick.memory_hook: Profit mein zyada milta hai, toh wapas jaane ke liye kam karo (ulta fraction)

alternatives.name: Direct Formula Method
alternatives.when_to_use: Jab percentage clean fraction na bane (17%, 23%, 13%)

steps.action: Percentages ko decimal mein convert karo aur 1 add karo
Final price ko result se divide karo

alternatives.name: Net Effect Formula
alternatives.one_liner: Net% = P₁ + P₂ + (P₁×P₂)/100, phir seedha use karo
alternatives.when_to_use: Jab sirf net profit% nikalna ho ya 2 hi transactions ho

common_mistakes.why: SP se CP nikalni hai, toh reverse calculation chahiye
Loss mein kam milta hai, toh fraction 1 se chhota hoga

deep.explanation:
Dekh bhai, jab chain mein profit hota hai - A ne B ko becha, B ne C ko becha - toh seedha percentage add nahi kar sakte. Kyun? Kyunki B jo profit le raha hai, wo A ke SP pe le raha hai, A ke CP pe nahi.

Soch iske baare mein:
- A ne ₹100 ka samaan khareeda
- 20% profit pe becha = ₹120 mein B ko
- B ne 25% profit lagaya = ₹120 ka 25% = ₹30
- C ne diya = ₹150

Ab agar hum ulta jaayein:
- C ne diya ₹150
- B ka profit nikalo: 150 × 4/5 = ₹120 (B ne itne mein khareeda)
- A ka profit nikalo: 120 × 5/6 = ₹100 (A ne itne mein khareeda)

Shortcut: Profit % ko fraction mein badlo, ulta karo, multiply karo. Bas!

shortcut.explanation:
Simple trick:
1. 20% profit = 6/5, ulta = 5/6
2. 25% profit = 5/4, ulta = 4/5
3. Final price × 5/6 × 4/5 = Original CP

Example: C paid 600
600 × 5/6 × 4/5 = 600 × 4/6 = 400

instant.explanation: Chain profit? Ulta fraction multiply. Done.
